results.name: Rows of triangle formed using Pascal's rule except begin and end n-th row with n+1.
comment: The number of spotlight tilings of an (m+1) X (n+1) rectangle, read by antidiagonals. - _Bridget Tenner_, Nov 09 2007
T(n,k) = A209561(n+2,k+1), 0 <= k <= n. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 26 2012
For a closed-form formula for arbitrary left and right borders of Pascal like triangle see A228196. - _Boris Putievskiy_, Aug 19 2013
For a closed-form formula for generalized Pascal's triangle see A228576. - _Boris Putievskiy_, Sep 09 2013
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 0..120 of triangle, flattened
B. E. Tenner, Spotlight tiling, Ann. Combin. 14 (4) (2010) 553.
Index entries for triangles and arrays related to Pascal's triangle
formula: T(m,n) = binomial(m+n,m) - binomial(m+n-2,m-1) (correct up to offset and transformation of square indices to triangular indices). - _Bridget Tenner_, Nov 09 2007
T(n,k) = binomial(n,k-1) + binomial(n,k) + binomial(n,k+1) for 0 <= k <= n.
maple: seq(seq(T(n, k), k=0..n), n=0..14);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, May 27 2013
mathematica: NestList[Append[ Prepend[Map[Apply[Plus, #] &, Partition[#, 2, 1]], #[[1]] + 1], #[[1]] + 1] &, {1}, 10] // Grid  (* _Geoffrey Critzer_, May 26 2013 *)

T[n_, k_] := T[n, k] = If[k<0 || k>n, 0, If[k==0 || k==n, n+1, T[n-1, k-1] + T[n-1, k]]]; Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 14}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 09 2016, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
program: for(n=0, 12, for(k=0, n, print1(T(n,k), ", "))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 18 2019
if k lt 0 or k gt n then return 0;
elif k eq 0 or k eq n then return n+1;
[T(n,k): k in [0..n], n in [0..12]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 18 2019
else: return T(n-1, k-1) + T(n-1, k)
[[T(n, k) for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..12)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 18 2019
if k<0 or k>n then return 0;
elif k=0 or k=n then return n+1;
Flat(List([0..12], n-> List([0..n], k-> T(n,k) ))); # _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 18 2019
